brewery.brewery_description: Brewed in Bangalow for the common good.

beer.beer_name: Wreck of The Bay West Coast DIPA
Wreck of The Bay West Coast DIPA

location.venue_address: Halliday Point Caravan Park, Blackhead Rd

beer.beer_description:
Located an hour‚Äôs drive from the brewery, the stunning Protesters Falls are so named as a group of locals lobbied in 1979 against a large area of state forest being logged.

The protest is regarded as a watershed moment in Australia's environmental movement and cited as the first time people physically defended a natural resource.

The area is now part of the World Heritage listed Nightcap National Park and will be preserved for future generations to appreciate.

Our IPA pays homage to this landmark movement by packing its own punch, with an intense hop profile of zesty fruits and tropical notes.

This aromatically driven beer is balanced out by a strong bitterness and a subtle malty finish that allows the combination of the new world hops to display their full character.

user.location: In a galaxy hop hop away

beer.beer_description:
Based on a traditional Czech pilsner with not so traditional additions of new world hops from both sides of the Tasman.

In the Aussie corner it's Australia's greatest contribution to beer... Galaxy hops, showcasing citrus, peach and passionfruit. In the New Zealand corner it's Nelson Sauvin hops with its distinctive white wine and black current notes.

This fruity pilsner is decidedly smashable!

user.bio: Work less, play more, drink better beer

user.location: In a galaxy hop hop away

user.bio: Cornish Beer Lover and Photographer Living In Suffolk, West Suffolk CAMRA....Plymouth Argyle....

beer.beer_description:
This latest creation is an approachable session hazy. Light on the alc so that you can jump back on the bike and hit the trail... when the rail trail comes to fruition, that is!

Hop varieties of Azacca and Galaxy give a pleasant mix of tropical fruits mixed with citrus. On the palate, it‚Äôs particularly spicy with mango, passionfruit, pineapple and some pine, with tangerine-esque qualities evident.

Finished with a dose of lactose to give a silky smooth balance between sweetness, fruit and bitterness.

beer.beer_description:
Located an hour‚Äôs drive from the brewery, the stunning Protesters Falls are so named as a group of locals lobbied in 1979 against a large area of state forest being logged.

The protest is regarded as a watershed moment in Australia's environmental movement and cited as the first time people physically defended a natural resource.

The area is now part of the World Heritage listed Nightcap National Park and will be preserved for future generations to appreciate.

Our IPA pays homage to this landmark movement by packing its own punch, with an intense hop profile of zesty fruits and tropical notes.

beer.beer_name: Wreck of The Bay West Coast DIPA
beer.beer_description: This is a BIG beer. This style originated on the West Coast of the USA and is a favourite of the craft beer industry. Made with a mixture of grains, including seldom seen quinoa, The Wreck has been infused with African pepper ‚ÄúGrains of Paradise‚Äù, giving a floral and spicy finish to this beer. Triple dry-hopped offering a huge nose and pallet of citrus and ripened tropical fruits. A complex creation balanced to perfection.

It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it‚Äôs time to drink it! That‚Äôs 235 check-ins with a photo.

When a single isn‚Äôt enough, make it a double. Doubling the hops and malts in a recipe results in a higher ABV and can pack quite a boozey punch. That's 10 different beers with the style that contains Imperial / Double in its style name. Try 5 more for Level 3!

beer.beer_description:
This latest creation is an approachable session hazy. Light on the alc so that you can jump back on the bike and hit the trail... when the rail trail comes to fruition, that is!

Hop varieties of Azacca and Galaxy give a pleasant mix of tropical fruits mixed with citrus. On the palate, it‚Äôs particularly spicy with mango, passionfruit, pineapple and some pine, with tangerine-esque qualities evident.

Finished with a dose of lactose to give a silky smooth balance between sweetness, fruit and bitterness.

As dark as a Moonless Midnight. Back in the day on the new moon and before the lighthouse was constructed, sailors braved pitch black conditions rounding Cape Byron. For over 120 years now, the shining light has guided ships safely past the treacherous rocks of the Byron Bay coastline. Moonless Midnight is also the perfect way to describe the darkness of our seasonal release Stout. Exhibiting notes of coffee, cacao and a hint of tobacco, it leads to a full-bodied sweetness balanced with a roasted malt flavour, finishing with a smooth bitterness. It may take you back to the time when the cape was dark and dangerous, or it might just feel like a nice big hug in a can. Contains lactose (and hugs).

beer.beer_description:
This is our take on a traditional German Helles lager. ‚ÄúHelles‚Äù meaning bright or light, using lightly coloured pilsner malts fermented for an extended time produces a clean lager with a soft finish that is carried through by a robust bitterness. Subtle notes of spice are also evident from the traditional noble hop Saaz. Well-balanced and finishing at 4.3% in alcohol, our Helles Hole should please all the lager enthusiasts out there.

We‚Äôre paying a cheeky nod to a hidden and treacherous spot in nearby Mount Jerusalem National Park. Yet another natural wonder in our little slice of paradise.

beer.beer_description:
So much esterey and phenolic flavours in a big beer. 
Perfect for the changing seasons

Located an hour‚Äôs drive from the brewery, the stunning Protesters Falls are so named as a group of locals lobbied in 1979 against a large area of state forest being logged.

The protest is regarded as a watershed moment in Australia's environmental movement and cited as the first time people physically defended a natural resource.

The area is now part of the World Heritage listed Nightcap National Park and will be preserved for future generations to appreciate.

Our IPA pays homage to this landmark movement by packing its own punch, with an intense hop profile of zesty fruits and tropical notes.

This aromatically driven beer is balanced out by a strong bitterness and a subtle malty finish that allows the combination of the new world hops to display their full character.

beer.beer_description:
Located an hour‚Äôs drive from the brewery, the stunning Protesters Falls are so named as a group of locals lobbied in 1979 against a large area of state forest being logged.

The protest is regarded as a watershed moment in Australia's environmental movement and cited as the first time people physically defended a natural resource.

The area is now part of the World Heritage listed Nightcap National Park and will be preserved for future generations to appreciate.

Our IPA pays homage to this landmark movement by packing its own punch, with an intense hop profile of zesty fruits and tropical notes.

This aromatically driven beer is balanced out by a strong bitterness and a subtle malty finish that allows the combination of the new world hops to display their full character.

This big hop forward Hazy IPA has a decidedly intense hop aroma of coconut and fresh pineapple. The two hops responsible are Sabro and El Dorado, offering that burst of tropical flavours. Its vibrant colour and shiny opaque appearance makes it look as juicy as it tastes with a super smooth finish derived from the protein haze. El Sabro has a gentle bitterness but packs a huge fruit punch that will make you forget we missed the summer..... Rediscover it for a moment in the glass sitting before you.

From Byron, to Bangalow and beyond, the lush hinterland is made up of a series of small villages, each with their own unique offerings. Our Villager‚Äôs Pale is made by the locals, for the locals and visitors alike.

An approachable session beer, our Pale is the perfect balance of new world hops, supported by a pleasing maltiness with a presence of citrus, resinous pine notes and just a slight hint of aniseed.

This is a beer that you‚Äôll always return to for its perfect combination of aromatics, smooth bitterness and satisfying malts.

As dark as a Moonless Midnight. Back in the day on the new moon and before the lighthouse was constructed, sailors braved pitch black conditions rounding Cape Byron. For over 120 years now, the shining light has guided ships safely past the treacherous rocks of the Byron Bay coastline. Moonless Midnight is also the perfect way to describe the darkness of our seasonal release Stout. Exhibiting notes of coffee, cacao and a hint of tobacco, it leads to a full-bodied sweetness balanced with a roasted malt flavour, finishing with a smooth bitterness. It may take you back to the time when the cape was dark and dangerous, or it might just feel like a nice big hug in a can. Contains lactose (and hugs).

This latest creation is an approachable session hazy. Light on the alc so that you can jump back on the bike and hit the trail... when the rail trail comes to fruition, that is!

Hop varieties of Azacca and Galaxy give a pleasant mix of tropical fruits mixed with citrus. On the palate, it‚Äôs particularly spicy with mango, passionfruit, pineapple and some pine, with tangerine-esque qualities evident.

Finished with a dose of lactose to give a silky smooth balance between sweetness, fruit and bitterness.

beer.beer_name: Wreck of The Bay West Coast DIPA
beer.beer_description: This is a BIG beer. This style originated on the West Coast of the USA and is a favourite of the craft beer industry. Made with a mixture of grains, including seldom seen quinoa, The Wreck has been infused with African pepper ‚ÄúGrains of Paradise‚Äù, giving a floral and spicy finish to this beer. Triple dry-hopped offering a huge nose and pallet of citrus and ripened tropical fruits. A complex creation balanced to perfection.

The deep red copper indicates a big malty backbone showcasing eight (yes eight!) different malts! 

Flavours of dark caramel, toffee and raisin are evident, combined with a big hop profile, notes of grapefruit and dare we say it... cannabis! 

This beer finishes with a robust bitterness, is well balanced and full of flavour. Hold this one up to the light of the fire and drink it in!

Our brand new Summer seasonal brew, the Spicy Boi Chilli Margarita Cerveza is our hottest creation yet. With a Mexican lager base, it has been brewed with malted corn which provides a subtle sweetness. Then we‚Äôve added all the ingredients of a refreshing margarita - right down to the zesty limes, salt and hints of agave.

But with a Common People twist, we're bringing the heat all the way to your bones with the addition of some fresh habanero chillies. Here for the warmer months, our new seasonal has a bit of a kick but at an ABV of 4.9%, it won‚Äôt send you sideways!


Always looking for ways to involve local producers and farmers, Common People reached out to local farmer Pete from Hinterland Hillbilly Chilly to procure some red hot habaneros. The chillies hit all your senses in the beer - you can smell them before you taste them.

The brew has a well balanced kick - not too hot if you generally can‚Äôt handle the heat, but if you love to warm your bones, you‚Äôll start to feel it at the end of the glass. And it continues to build up as you get stuck into the next one!

Synonymous with the highly revered coastline of our area and indeed our entire country, the back beach is that hidden secret spot we all love to visit.

It's all about relaxation and enjoyment - much like our refreshingly unique white ale.

This light and crisp wheat beer is driven by Belgian yeast, offering hints of spice and wheat phenolics and has just the perfect hint of tartness and balanced malty sweetness.

Its clean and thick foamy head makes it the perfect thirst quencher that will see you doubling down for another tall glass.

This is our take on a traditional German Helles lager. ‚ÄúHelles‚Äù meaning bright or light, using lightly coloured pilsner malts fermented for an extended time produces a clean lager with a soft finish that is carried through by a robust bitterness. Subtle notes of spice are also evident from the traditional noble hop Saaz. Well-balanced and finishing at 4.3% in alcohol, our Helles Hole should please all the lager enthusiasts out there.

We‚Äôre paying a cheeky nod to a hidden and treacherous spot in nearby Mount Jerusalem National Park. Yet another natural wonder in our little slice of paradise.

We have 'gone dark' on this Black IPA. An intensely rich cacophony of nine different malts imparts caramels, cocoa nibs and a hint of roasted notes, balanced with an equally intense dank and resinous hop forward profile. There‚Äôs so much body in this beer, you could cut it with a knife.

As indulgent as the name suggests. This kettle soured creation has masses of fresh raspberries and blackberries from our friends at Blueberry Fields in Brooklet. Finished off with intense Christmas cherries from Orange, this sour is a perfect harmony of tart and sweet fruit accentuated by the saison yeast imparting its own fruit to this orchestra of flavour. The iridescent pink colouring will leave you with no doubt of what is about to delight the taste buds. Merry Christmas to all!

Paying homage to founders‚Äô eight kids who have clocked some serious hours at the brewery while their parents worked furiously to open the doors, the Ankle Biter is also a tribute to our fearless GM who suffered a nasty burn on his leg when brewing this beer.

This full body California Common (Steam Ale) is brewed with lager yeast and fermented at ale temperatures. The result offers the formation of a big ester profile. Late hopping of Amarillo produces citrusy orange and grapefruit notes on the nose and palate. Big on the residual malt and bitterness you would be forgiven for thinking this is a full strength beer but at an ABV of 3.5%, you can head back to the bar for another.

This is our most lip-puckering of creations yet! Using a magical strain of lactobacillus 'Helveticus‚Äô, we have dialled up the flavour intensity.

A tip of the hat to our local legend Simon who supplied masses of delicious tangelos from his trees around the corner. What even is a tangelo, you ask? Think a cross between a naval orange and a grapefruit, giving a unique sweet and tart flavour perfectly complementing the style.

A perfect palate cleanser with any meal, with enough heat to warm those winter bones!

Our latest offering is a Fresh Hop Rye Golden Ale. This beer has been hopped the entire length with fresh hops cones or hop flowers. The hop cones can only be sourced fresh once a year and an absolute truckload has been added to this beer offering aromatic pine, citrus and floral notes.

The malty backbone of this beer is a Vampire Rye grain that imparts a spicy, bready and peppery flavour. The Rye also offers a notable creamier body and mouthfeel. A unique and complex beer that is a perfect winter drop.

In Belgium, beer craftmanship is part of the culture and tradition. In Bangalow our tradition lies in the billycart, which every year is raced down our main street by brave locals. To celebrate the return of the Bangalow Billycart Derby we have decided to splice these two great traditions into one delicious beer - the Billycart Blonde.
This Belgian Blonde has a bright golden appearance, with a sweet malty aroma of honey and spice. The smooth and rounded mouthfeel balances well with tastes of honeydew, finishing with a medium bitterness.

Just like the ride down the Bangalow main street, at 7.6% ABV this beer is not for the faint at heart, but may just be the best ride of your life.

Fortune favours the brave!

Faster than a speeding bullet, more flavoursome than a double-stack of tropical fruit!

This Super XPA is the perfect showcase for the Superdelic hop, used exclusively on this brew.Intense and vibrant, the nose bursts with tropical fruit notes ‚Äî ripe mango, juicy passionfruit and zesty tangerine.

A touch of candied citrus adds sweetness and complexity. High carbonation provides a nice effervescence that amplifies the fresh candied orange flavours.

Gentle on the bitterness and bright on the aromas, it might not give you x-ray vision, but our Super XPA has ultimate thirst quenching superpowers!

Brewed by our in-house sound techs turned brewers, our Sound Czech Pilsner is sure to resonate with all the lager fans out there.

A perfectly balanced mix of malt, hops and esters. This Pilsner has a big malty backbone showcasing flavours of sweet biscuit and fresh bread. A gentle bitterness from the old-world Saaz hops provides a herbal tea and spice character with a crisp, refreshing finish.

There‚Äôs a slight hint of honey and caramel sweetness that adds depth and body.

So, turn up and get dialled in on this number!

Based on a traditional Czech pilsner with not so traditional additions of new world hops from both sides of the Tasman.

In the Aussie corner it's Australia's greatest contribution to beer... Galaxy hops, showcasing citrus, peach and passionfruit. In the New Zealand corner it's Nelson Sauvin hops with its distinctive white wine and black current notes.

This fruity pilsner is decidedly smashable!

The Dubbel Drunk Monk is a Belgian Style Dubbel - a complex mix of rich toasted malts combining flavours of raisins and plum. Dried fruits and caramels accompany the hints of banana in the phenolics. Hold it up to the light and let your eyes drink in that rich reddish copper before toasting to the monks that created the style, then welcome the complex brew to the palate.

Roll up, roll up! Introducing the aptly named Paradise Circus - there's a lot going on in this number. 

Taking the stage in the first act is Belgian yeast which offers a complexity of sweetness and phenolic spice. 

The second act is a mass of rolled oats and wheat in the mix offering a hazy, silky smoothness. 

For the grand finale, African 'Grains of Paradise' pepper adding to flavours of citrus, floral jasmine and hints of hazelnut. 

Grab yourself a Paradise Circus and enjoy the show!

The first in our series of staff brews, helped along through recipe development and brewing by our Belgian born bar manager, Sarah. This beer displays a golden colour, delicate bitterness and the addition of amber candied sugar makes it a formidable Belgian Triple. It is said that after two or three of these, people take on the form of other worldly beings.....Werewolves!

Over the past 10 months our Belgian Billycart Blonde has been residing in ex-rum barrels from our friends at the Lord Byron Distillery, creating an otherworldly beer for all of the senses.

The silky smooth vanilla and oak notes imparted by the barrels. The characteristic rum flavour. The phenolic and spice from the Belgian Blonde beer. And the warming heat from the higher alcohols. All working in perfect balance.

Get your tastebuds around this delicious creation while you can!
Northern IPA
Mango Sour
